description:
In the 90th year since its foundation, Benevento Calcio is the first Serie B team to join the large Monopoly family.

Play with the protagonists of the 2019/2020 season and relive the emotions related to the recent history of the Samnite Club. Challenge friends and relatives, manage your finances in the best possible way, show all your Giallorossi passion and become the champion of Benevento Calcio Monopoly.


Nel 90esimo anno dalla sua fondazione, il Benevento Calcio é la prima squadra della Lega Serie B ad entrare nella grande famiglia del Monopoly.

Gioca con i protagonisti della stagione 2019/2020 e rivivi le emozioni legate alla storia recente del Club sannita. Sfida amici e parenti, amministra al meglio le tue finanze, mostra tutta la tua passione giallorossa e diventa il campione di Benevento Calcio Monopoly.

The Airborne Museum of Sainte-Mère-Eglise presents its own edition of the game Monopoly. In this version, the Rue de la Paix gives way to the Waco glider, the Place du Paradis has become an M2 helmet and instead of becoming the owner of the Boulevard des Capucines, players will be able to acquire a Sherman tank. The players are thus in the shoes of a museum curator and will compete to acquire the most beautiful collector's items from the Airborne Museum!


L'Airborne Museum de Sainte-Mère-Eglise présente sa propre édition du jeu Monopoly. Dans cette version, la rue de la paix laisse place au planeur Waco, la place du Paradis est devenue un casque M2 et à la place de devenir propriétaire du boulevard des Capucines, les joueurs pourront acquérir un char Sherman. Les joueurs sont ainsi dans la peau d'un conservateur de musée et s'affronteront pour acquérir les plus belles pièces de collection du Airborne Museum !

çŸ©é™£è¬Žèªž (Lost in the Grids) was released as part of the 2020 Taiwanese convention "150 Boardgame Con" where games sell for 150 TWD, roughly $5 USD.

The game consists of a limited deck of cards, with suits visible on the back; some player tokens; and some magnifying glass tokens.

The players' goal is to arrange the cards into a grid such that no suit or rank is duplicated in a row or column.  On a turn, a player may choose to use the magnifying glass tokens to peak at a card in the grid or a players hand; then, they must play two cards, one face up and one face down, and can play them into the grid or aside.

At the end of the game, all cards are flipped face up and any cards in a row or column which share a suit or rank are removed.  Players earn positive points for cards remaining in the grid and unused tokens, and lose points for cards removed from the grid.  The players can then compare their score to a rubric to see how well they did, from "No comment." to "Psychic!"

Far to the north, in a remote winter land, rivers are frozen most of the year. When the villages along the riverside eventually are accessible, a small river cruise company offers exotic tours like polar bear safaris, reindeer trips, ice fishing, and more. Lucky tourists may even get a chance to see the northern lights.

You work as a tour guide trying to attract tourists to your guide boats for spectacular excursions.

Riverside is a different kind of roll-and-write game: The game comes with a modular game board, which composes the route for the game. On a river cruise boat, everyone follows the same route, but you can take your tourists on different tours. You may plan ahead, but beware, the dice may force you to change your plans.

You start each round by rolling dice into a common pool. Simultaneously, each player chooses one die of one specific color (without physically taking it) and fill seats on the matching guiding boat on their own player sheet. Whenever they have completed a row of seats, they have sold a group ticket of the corresponding color (excursion). The longer the row, the more points they get. Additionally, this ticket is valid for the remainder of the game: Every time they go on an excursion in a village of this color, they take this group with them to earn even more points. The player with the most points wins the game.

Each dice color represents tourists with a preference for one specific type of excursion. The transparent green die is "wild" and represents the northern lights, something everyone wants to see.

Riverside offers tough decision-making within a short playing time: Some rows are short with low points and bonuses, while other rows are long with higher points and bonuses. Which one do you start to fill? Within each guide boat, you need to score higher and higher, so taking too many tourists on your first excursions could be fateful. Players are rewarded if they manage to please all five kinds of tourists, so maybe you need to score a new color instead of scoring really high in another color? Higher dice represent tourists who are freezing and cost fire symbols to get. Note that the "wild" green die always costs fire symbols to get! You have a limited number of fire symbols to use, so when will be the right time to use them?

—description from the designer

Granada is a beautiful city in the South of Spain where you can find all kinds of people. Like any other night, after a fancy dinner at the casino, four players meet around a poker table. They are Vladimir Lavrov “The Russian”, escorted by his bodyguard Sasha, Brad Clayton, Claudine, and her friend Sophie. One of the players will never see a new day.

Instacrime is a cooperative game system which introduces you to a mystery that needs to be solved by a group of detectives. Each player must describe the contents of their photographs in order to share the information at their disposal with the objective of setting out a joint theory that explains the case.

Each case is unique and unrepeatable, and therefore, it can only be played once.

But don’t worry! If you want to make the most of it, let a group of friends play it and have fun listening to their theories.

-description from the publisher

The Shanghai-Nanking Campaign 1937 (SNC) is a two-player historical simulation of the largest single military campaign fought anywhere in the world during the interwar period. The Japanese player is primarily on the offensive, attempting nothing less than ending China’s existence as an independent country via the political shock of the rapid conquest of that country’s primary port and capital cities. The units of maneuver are Japanese regiments or Chinese divisions. Japanese regiments were uniform and varied on their combat experience. Chinese divisions varied in manpower and training and so their combat strength and second step are reflective of those factors. Each hexagon on the map represents seven miles (11 km) from side to opposite side. Each full game turn represents approximately two weeks.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

S&T #329 May-June 2021

Thirty Years War Battles is a grand tactical two player system for simulating battles in Europe during the first half of the 17th century. Each game in the system is based on one of the major battles of the 30 Years War. Each battle has its own map, special rules and counters representing the military formations which participated in the original action. The rules model the overall effects of the weapons and tactics of the great era of pike and shot, and include combat, leadership and morale. Players command armies of infantry, cavalry and artillery, each with their own special capabilities, as well as the great leaders who took the field in this era. Each hex on the map represents 150-200 meters. Each game turn (GT) represents 45 minutes to one hour. Most cavalry and infantry units represent one or two regiments or battalions. Each combat strength point represents 75 to 150 men, depending on the quality of the army and assignment of light guns to the unit. Each artillery unit represents four to six heavy or medium guns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

S&T #332 Nov-Dec 2021

"Rio Grande War" is a two-player wargame on a hypothetical war between the United States and the Empire of Mexico following the American Civil War. The assumption is that France's Napoleon III decided to back up Maximilian with the French army to maintain his power in Mexico, and the US responded with an invasion. At stake: the fate of North America!

One side commands the Imperial forces (Maximilian and his French allies), and the other the Allies (US and Mexican Republic). The central game mechanism is Action Points (AP). AP are a quantification of each sides command and logistical capabilities. Players expend AP to recruit units and conduct various military operations. Each hex on the map represents 45 miles. Each game turn (GT) represents one to two months. Combat units represent divisions, brigades, regiments, and groups of partisans/bandits. Infantry and cavalry units include attached artillery, pioneer and logistic support. Leaders represent an inspirational to competent commander plus whatever troops they bring to the field.

S&T #334 Mar-Apr 2022

We've collected over 300 of the world's raunchiest, cheesiest and silliest dad jokes.  Also includes 150 blank cards to record your own dad jokes.

The game's simple. One player reads a joke to the opposing player. If either player laughs, they lose a point. Deliver your own joke, instead of the one on the card, and you can earn double points.

At the end of each hand, players can tag in or out with other members of their team (if you feel a burst of giggles coming on.)

The game ends when a player or team reaches the agreed upon amount of points needed to win. A player or team wins when it collects enough points by not laughing at the joke more often than their opponent.

Ahau: Rulers of Yucatán is a Euro-style board game, combining elements of worker placement and resource management with innovative dual-engine building - all set in the Classical Period of the Maya.

In the game, the players take the roles of leaders of city-states who are all eager to climb the ladder of power and become the most famous ruler of this era. Throughout their journey, they have the chance to invoke the ancient Maya deities, make the production flourish, build their pyramid temple and capital, and expand the borders of their territory.

Ahau is a homage to the breathtaking Maya culture, bringing their history closer to the players. The cultural and historical aspects of the game were closely checked by Mayanist David S. Anderson, professor of anthropology and archaeology, an instructor at the Radford University in Virginia, U.S.

The Solo Mode was co-designed with professional game designer, David Digby.

Monopoly FK Partizan this edition takes in the Serbian football team of Partizan Belgrade.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend money.

(You should know how to calculate)

Rules:

Each player should have a pencil in his own color. Define a starting player. The active player rolls the dice and has to combine all 5 dice using the basic arithmetic methods (addition / subtraction / multiplication / division) to reach a number that has not been calculated by any other player before. He then can mark this number (e.g. circle, cross out, box ). The player can, but does not have to, use all types of calculations methods. He can e.g. use only addition or e.g. once addition, once subtraction and twice multiplication. He can use brackets to work with the dot-before-dash calculation. Only whole numbers are allowed in the calculation process.

End of game:

The players play alternately. The game ends as soon as the numbers in 3 rows or columns (or a combination thereof) are circled.

Valuation:

The rows and the columns then are evaluated one after the other:


     Whoever has the majority in a row receives  5 points
     Whoever has the majority in a row where the numbers are completely circled/marked receives 10 points



     If several players have circled the same amount of numbers, nobody gets points


The backside shows the game Knüller, which also can be played.

—description from the designer

Beneath the waves the bodies float. Silently drifting towards the shore. Drawn by a prophecy that soon they shall become. A crumbling tower rises before them. Strange lights burning within. One final effort and then no more. One final no more.

Tower of Silence is a dark and brutal game of abandoned hope and apocalyptic prophecy. Players take on the roles of shipwrecked souls washing ashore at the base of a mountainous tower slowly crumbling away into the icy seas. Drawn like moths to the flame that burns high above, they begin a long and harrowing climb which will either see them lost in the shadows of death or transformed in the fires of prophecy.

Each turn players take control of a new soul (up to a maximum of three souls per player) and roll their starting hope and location. As souls crawl about and make various efforts, their hope dwindles, and once it is all gone, they become shadows of death further draining the hope of those who follow after them. If a soul manages to reach the top of the tower, the player controlling it burns the corresponding standee in a black candle and draws a prophetic uttering. Once all souls have either abandoned hope or been consigned to the flames, the utterings are lined up to produce a unique prophecy for that game only.

Tower of Silence is the first installment in the Trilogy of Lost Hope which continues with Iron Mountain and Pesta. It comes with a dedicated soundtrack (Stilhedens Tårn) recorded and released by dungeon synth artist Offermose. Players are encouraged to listen to the album as they play. A streaming link is provided in the rulebook.

—description from the designer

Monopoly Edizione Bergamo, this edition takes in the Italian city of Bergamo in Lombardy.

The board shows the Bergamasque toponymy: places such as Monterosso, Redona, the Piazza Vecchia or San Vigilio.

This edition is published after the city was badly hit by the Covid pandemic in early 2020, and part of its benefits will go to the Mutual Aid Fond setup by the municipality.


Monopoly Edizione Bergamo, questa edizione si svolge nella città italiana di Bergamo in Lombardia.

Il tabellone mostra la toponomastica bergamasca: luoghi come Monterosso, Redona, Piazza Vecchia o San Vigilio.

Questa edizione è stata pubblicata dopo che la città è stata duramente colpita dalla pandemia di Covid all'inizio del 2020 e parte dei suoi benefici andranno al Fondo di Mutuo Soccorso istituito dal comune.

In early September 1925, two separate military disasters rocked the United States: a bungled flight during which three Navy seaplanes failed to make it from the West Coast to Hawaii; and, the loss of the Navy's first helium-filled airship and prized treasure, USS Shenandoah and 14 of its crew while flying over the Midwest on an ill-advised public relations tour.

Were these accidents?

Or were they the "result of the incompetency, the criminal negligence, and the almost treasonable negligence of our national defense by the Navy and the War Departments?”

One man would sacrifice his career to take-on the Army, the Navy and the White House to answer these questions.

Blood was on someone's hands and unless something changed, more aviators were going to die in the “old flaming coffins."

Prophet Without Honor, is a courtroom showdown between an officer with a radical idea versus the military establishment keen to remind the world a prophet is without honor in his own home.

In this 2-player card and dice development game, you, as the prosecution or defense, must convince a military tribunal that American aviator, Colonel William (Billy) Mitchell, is guilty...or innocent.

The game begins in the courtroom where Colonel Mitchell of the Army Air Service is being tried for his alleged violation of the 96th Article of War, a catchall provision of military law that would decide if his incendiary, public remarks brought discredit upon the military service.

Players will draft and play cards which will help them strengthen their case with the jurors and recruit them to their side and find overwhelming evidence for or against the accused.

In the longest and most controversial court martial in US history (October 28-December 17, 1925), will the evangelist of Airpower be vindicated?

Or will the nation remain vulnerable to emerging enemies and have to wait 17 years for his predictions to be proven true...at Pearl Harbor.

This is a standalone game. It is volume 2 in the Trial Series by Green Feet Games (previous Volume includes Unforgiven: The Lincoln Assassination Trial).

America was built by people like Mitchell who questioned the status quo and believed that there was always a better way...that would fundamentally change how a nation secures its interests and projects military power.
   
—description from the publisher

Napolean Von Wienerschnitzel is hosting a contest and the greatest chefs in the land have gathered in his grillyard to vie for the coveted Golden Skillet. The challenge is simple. Bid to acquire lots of meat (and lesser foods) and pair them with as much Bacon you can acquire to create sizzling and crispy creations of deliciousness! The chef who goes whole hog and lays out the best bacon-wrapped spread of delights will be crowned the Golden Skillet Champion!

BACON!!! is a real-time auction game in which players are trying to win piles of facedown cards that are being slowly revealed by the auctioneer. The goal of BACON!!! is to acquire a mix of Food cards and Bacon cards (to wrap around the Food) in order to score the most points.

BACON!!! is a delicious mix of skill, luck, and timing.

—description from the publisher

This game is played on a board of concentric rings divided into spaces. Each space has a symbol (heart, diamond, spade, or shamrock).

Each player has four pieces which they enter in the outer ring and attempt to move to the center. Pieces are moved by die roll. Landing on an opposing piece sends it back to the start.

When a piece lands on a symbol which is covered by a piece on a different space, this forms a "pair" and entitled the moving piece to move inwards to the next circle. If this forms another pair it may move again.

Best 11 Board Game: AC Milan football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: AC Milan
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

Best 11 Board Game: Genoa football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: Genoa
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

Best 11 Board Game: U.C. Sampdoria football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 Board Game: U.C. Sampdoria
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

The Battle of Adrica is a dice rolling, area control, resource management and soldier elimination game where players take on the role of commanders in charge of their battalion as they are tasked to secure different location in Adrica based on the natural resources in the region.

It was inspired by a make-believe world of what could have happened if the Berlin Conference for the scramble of Africa was not peaceful among the colonials.

Please note: This is a stand-alone game from the previous base-game.

—description from the publisher

The deck of cards consists of an "A" and "B" card for each of the 27 presidents included.  The A card has the dates of his presidency, his political party and his birth and death dates; the B card lists a varying number of significant events of his life or his presidential terms.

Some cards have two presidents on them, presumably because they wanted to include all of them up to the current one at the time of manufacture (Herbert Hoover) while preserving the 54-card deck.

—user summary

Best 11 SSC Napoli  football box game! 
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team. 
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11. 
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Best 11 SSC Napoli 
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team. 
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11. 
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

Breakthrough is a strategy game where two tank armies fight each other. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the other end of the board (break through the enemy’s frontline). It has some similarity to Checkers, but the strategy is completely different.

Each team consists of the following units:
2 heavy tanks
4 tank destroyers
10 medium tanks

The game is played with 1:200 scale models. A blue German army fights against a green Soviet one.

—description from the designer

Journey to distant Africa. Discover hot desert, life giving river Nil and hidden in the sand Oasis. Meet incredible animals, which lives there. Don't be fooled by mirages and remember about magic talismans, which can change Your faith.

This is a simple square tile placing game where each corner can have a different color which have to match when placing the tiles next to one another. Players score immediately after placing their tile and moves their pawn on scoring track based on the number of connecting animals with additional points matching animal kind, plus star symbols.
Each player has set of special tokens allowing unique actions. After using special action mysterious oasis tile is added to the game by the active player. To reveal it needs to be surrounded from all sides. When flipped over it adds or reduces points based on animals around it - whenever it turns out to be a mirage or actual oasis.

Sydney, Australia in the 1920s is a hotbed of crime and vice. The inner city suburbs of Darlinghurst and Surrey Hills are a battleground between warring gangs led by prostitute Tilly Devine and sly grog queen Kate Leigh. And in the middle of it all is you, a detective for the New South Wales Police, just trying to solve the crimes and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Razorhurst is a story-driven detective game similar to Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective. You will interview suspects, follow leads, and use your abilities for observation, persuasion and force. Razorhurst introduces a unique clock mechanic for affecting the player's abilities. But the main difference with other detective games is that in Razorhurst everything is real. You will be investigating actual crimes, tracking down historical evidence, and bringing actual killers to justice. Based on exhaustive research, Razorhurst allows the player to step back in time to one of the most heady and deadly places in history.

—description from the designer

Ambush is a fast-paced, fantasy-themed strategy card game with exciting, dynamic gameplay centered around a cast of colorful characters with different abilities. Ambush seeks to provide the perfect blend of thrilling action and intense strategy in a game where the tide of battle can be turned in the blink of an eye! Take control of your personal castle and craft the perfect army of goblins, wizards, and knights to attack your opponents and defend your own walls from harm. The goal of the game is to be the last castle standing at the end of the hectic free-for-all.

To do this, players will need to plan and strategize for the Ambush phase, where any card played in the game so far is up for grabs in a mad scramble that has a chance to be triggered at the start of every player’s turn. Having the speed and reflexes to grab the best cards first, as well as remembering where the best cards are on the field will be critical in obtaining the upper hand over other players.

Ambush was created as a project for a USC Games class in the fall of 2019 by Michael Ford, Brendan Tighe, Masato Lin, and Tongwei Dai. The team saw some incredible potential in the game, and in the Spring of 2020,a portion of the group reformed and set out to publish and sell the game with the help of USC faculty and developers from other board game start-ups.

—description from the designer

Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously.  Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of AEGIS. Featuring Poppet, Stell, Ixa, Gamound, Etwal, and Ainer

—description from the publisher

Each player chooses a paragon and takes their deck of 7 unique cards. Every turn, players choose a card from their hand and play them simultaneously.  Both cards are revealed and then characters either take damage, have their card canceled and sent back to their hand, or are defeated. Play the right card at the right time and have a strong read of your opponent's intentions to win!

This box features 6 characters from the world of Rivals of Aether. Featuring Zetterburn, Orcane, Kragg, Wrastor, Clairen, Ranno. Characters in this box feature an additional special move instead of a block ability. Use your additional ability to control your opponents!

—description from the publisher

The dungeon deck consists of 104 cards representing six dungeon levels, monsters, treasures, traps, doors, empty corridors, dead ends and stairs up.  While exploring a nearby dungeon, you found a horde of monsters planning something big for your nearby village. You were attacked and fell off a ledge in to the void. Left for dead by the monsters, you now have to make your way out of the dungeon and back to your village. You have no ideas where you are or how to get out but you have to escape and your are running out of time. Each corridor you take could lead you closer to the exit or directly into a dead end. Keep running and if you hit a dead end turn around and continue running. You can't stop and you must escape.  Each turn presents new dangers and possible treasures.  If you can survive long enough to make it through four stairs up you escape the dungeon alive.    Take too long or hit too many dead ends and you may never make it out alive.

—description from the designer

"Our new Queen is finding us a new home after her statement with her rival. As a member of her royal guard, we must protect her. The problem is she is so fast and always finds her way into trouble!"

Save the Queen!

In Save the Queen! you are a royal guard sent to protect the Queen Bee as you search for a new home. Defeat other insects as you compete for territories, but bee careful; you only have so much nectar and so much time to get to a new home before the colony dies.

Combat is based on hopping over opponents, like solitaire or checkers, with the addition of special abilities. Navigate through cards valued between 1 and 3 territories, with increased difficulty for each value.

—description from the publisher

The Official 1997 ICE Hockey World Championship game. It is tactical dice driven game for two players.

It has all the main elements of ice hockey. More goals and some times set wins achieved player wins the game. There is also possibility to the stalemate.

Players try to make more goals than opponent. Game is played in special icehockey looking game board with different symbols and places for five icehockey players and goalkeeper in each team. Also board has movement symbols which are used by turns depending to dice rolls. There is some randomness with hidden marks in game board that players try to find. This are shot, missed shot, tackle, offside, break, block, empty, goal , set win and joker.

Ð¦Ðµ Ð‘Ñ–Ð·Ð½ÐµÑ ÐšÑ€Ð¸Ñ…Ñ–Ñ‚ÐºÐ° ("This is Business Baby") is a board game with unique mechanics for those who want to learn financial literacy, improve their time management skills, and plunge into the world of entrepreneurship.

The game has a completely unique methodology and is based on the "win-win" strategy, where the most important thing is not victory, but the analysis of your actions during the game and interaction with other players.

In a playful way, you:

     learn about the methods of earning;
     organize your own business;
     get the necessary skills to start your own business;
     understand the importance of the resource of time;
     train your creative thinking skills;
     make your dream come true.

The first player throws the dice and moves onto the board starting at the central YELLOW HUB SPACE.
Players travel in a clockwise direction around each leaf in any order they wish and when they have collected all five spliffs they make their way to the BIG SPLIFF SPACE.
Whichever player arrives there first with all five spliff cards, forming a complete spliff is the winner.

A card based party game where you combine object and feature cards to create a wacky new invention. You then pitch your invention to the group in hopes to advance your invention to the next round.

Each round you can play the role of the inventor, the buyer, and the marketing agent. During each role you may contribute an additional function, a slogan/catch phrase, or market to a specific target audience.

Each successful contribution may award you royalty money.

In the end the inventor with the most investment capital wins.

A wacky, multi-player party game of outlandish on-the-spot creativity.

A game for all types of gamers. Roll custom dice and move your Steampunk inspired wooden pawn onto a betting track. Move up and including your dice roll to maneuver your pawn into a pot winning position or block your opponents from taking the pot.

2 solitaire versions, 4 different variations to play.

For 1-8 players with the ability to add as many players as you want with your own tokens. Each round takes 5-10 minutes and players play as many rounds as they like, or as determined by a dice roll.

—description from the publisher

Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

Each investigation propels you into a different universe, but almost always on a crime scene.

This crime scene is spread over several cards to form a great illustration. To investigate, nothing more simple. Take a card to take a closer look. An item intrigues you ? Flip the card over and find out what is this little paper on the bedside table.

An address ? You can now take the card that corresponds to this track. Unless another element on the crime scene appeals you even more ?

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty ? What is his mobile ? What is the murder weapon ? And some subsidiary questions, of course.

Do not miss the culprit otherwise you will lose the game. But if you answer the questions correctly, the number of cards you will not reveal will decide you.

The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: Oiseau de malheur is the second case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in Paris in 2018.

—description from the publisher

Crime Zoom is a series of investigation game for 1 and more players and for plays of about 1 hour.

Each investigation propels you into a different universe, but almost always on a crime scene.

This crime scene is spread over several cards to form a great illustration. To investigate, nothing more simple. Take a card to take a closer look. An item intrigues you ? Flip the card over and find out what is this little paper on the bedside table.

An address ? You can now take the card that corresponds to this track. Unless another element on the crime scene appeals you even more ?

In Crime Zoom, you will conduct your investigation freely. Discuss between players to choose the tracks to follow. And as soon as you think you have solved the case, go to the questionnaire. Who is guilty ? What is his mobile ? What is the murder weapon ? And some subsidiary questions, of course.

Do not miss the culprit otherwise you will lose the game. But if you answer the questions correctly, the number of cards you will not reveal will decide you.

The solution will answer each of the questions. The epilogue will come to tell all this in a story or a testimony history to understand the plot that has been played.

Crime Zoom: No Furs is the forth case of the Crime Zoom family. It brings you in London in 2019.

—description from the publisher

The 2nd of 3 volumes. 
Funny – AF no artificial flavors or colors. 
The game that highlights stereotypes of urban culture, says everything that you hear behind closed doors and reflects on how you grew up. 
You are ready to play this game if you know: 
1) The type of car dope boys drive 
2) What to do if you get hit in school 
3) How many times to reuse chicken grease 
4) How to play spades 
5) How to survive prison. 
The objective of the game is to not lose points by predicting what answers the opposing teams will select. 
Comes with 4 Passports, a pink box, 78 trivia cards (categories: Trap (21), Entertainment (26), Lifestyle (23), History (8)), plays up to 24 people.

Instructions: 
Pick a host responsible for reading cards and keeping score. Form three or more teams and give them on set of A, B, C, D Decision cards. 
Teams show Decision cards at the same time. 
Cards with Facts (32) have answers captured in bold. Cards with Majority Vote (46) can only have one A, B, C, D answer. Teams that tie on Majority Vote cards don’t lose a point. 
The majority vote determines the answer. 
All of the above is not a valid answer. 
Teams start with 10 points and lose a point for incorrect answers. The last team with points wins and gets a Passport To The Hood.

—description from the publisher

Roach Party is a fun party board game that mimics the lifestyle of an everyday pot smoker. What many may not know is this game has been around for a long time and you really never hear anything about it.

It was originally released in 1979, right after Cheech & Chong’s first movie, Up in Smoke. Roach Party was sold in head shops when they began popping up in the 80’s. It had great success, sold thousands of copies and was even featured in High Times Magazine. All was good until feds started raiding the shops and merchandise was seized, thus resulting in the disappearance of this really awesome stoner game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate a COMPLETE STASH. This is done by collecting all four of the ROACH CARDS. These include the BAGGIE, PAPERS, FIRE, and SUPPLIER cards.
Lastly you must acquire the funds to pay your supplier. Once you have all four cards and the funds required pay your supplier, you are the winner of Roach Party.

The Story Of My Life: A Trivia Game For Women

A fun-filled journey highlighting the social, personal and cultural experiences that cultivate the life stories of women.

Play this game and find out what stories you have in common with your friends.

—description from the publisher

The time is now for dark secrets to come to light. The world is in chaos and only an elite few know the truth behind the scenes. There is an invisible and powerful force working in the shadows, manipulating the masses to control our world.

Playing as a global elite ruler in 2020, in this hybrid, deck-building / worker placement game, you must first build your cabal by acquiring assets. Then, use your best strategy to attack your enemies and successfully stage events on the global scale. Your goal is to stay invisible, while gaining power over the masses using your best strategy and card based, dice battles.

The winner is the first player to enter the "eye in the triangle" with 13 power points, where you rule the world and no one knows you exist.

The board works like a clock from above, with three dice rolled simultaneously to move the 3 main Board Pieces. The lower level of the board contains the assets, the middle level holds the special cards and the top, zodiac level is for pyramid activation, betting and scoring.
 Do you have what it takes to reach the top
of the pyramid and become, The Powers That Be?

—description from the designer

Glyffiti is a tile placement game where each player takes the role of an aspiring spellcaster. They work together to cast a city-wide megaspell, while competing to ensure the spell fits their secret agendas.

Players take turns doing one of three actions: Drawing a glyph tile from the bag, playing a glyph tile to the board, or removing a glyph tile from the board. Each glyph has a primary and secondary element, of the classical fire, water, air, earth, or spirit.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives three agenda cards, of which they choose one to keep. This card lists how the player will score at the end of the game. They will gain points for some element types, and lose points for others. Score is based on what elements are present in the outer five spaces when all ten spaces are filled.

-description from designer

Bluffy Pirates is an extremely fun, highly competitive, strategic party game, suited for groups from 4 to 6 people. The game is usually full of good (and bad ) emotions, as two main key aspects are timing and, as the name suggests, bluffing.

Each round, players fight each other for one of the many different magical treasures. During one's turn, the player has two choices: either play a card with a symbol of the treasure of the round, or skip the turn, waiting for better opportunities, or simply missing the necessary card to play. Players take turns clockwise, deciding on the best strategy to win the treasure. Once a player holds a treasure for an entire turn, he gets to take it back to his ship and gains its special effect. The game is over, once a player collects 4 different treasures.

The best part of the game is when you feel like a mastermind, like you've outsmarted all of your friends.  While everyone was fighting for the treasure, you were waiting for the perfect moment to strike. Just when one of your friends was about to take the treasure back to his ship, you laugh at his face and curb his expectations, by taking the treasure into your own hands. You feel ecstatic, you are about to win the game. And just at the moment when you think that you had it in the bag... One of your friends starts laughing at your face and you very well know, what's about to come.

Mole king has a story that finds the greatest mole king.

The ‘mole kings’ of each country that govern peaceful mole kingdoms. One day, they heard a rumor about a land full of gold and silver, and they went on a journey to find the land of gold. As if they had made such a promise, the ‘mole kings’ of each country have gathered on the land of gold. You become a ‘mole king’ to drive out other kingdoms and occupy the land of gold. Who will take over the land of gold and become the best ‘mole king’!

Cute artwork with components and easy tile placement is the strength of this game.

Components are 61 Cards, 20 Gold&Silver tokens, 4 Makers, and 4 Quick reference Cards.

Game Setup, each player takes their color's cards(15), 1 gold token, and 1 reference card. All players flip the reference card to the other side then see the brown border that player has become the start player.
All players draw 4 cards from the deck and place the starting card in the middle of the table.

Gameplay action has only 6 steps.

     Return: Take the maker that the player placed in the previous round back to the player's hand.



     Placement: Select a card from hand and placed it. Do not place it diagonally.



     Acquisition: If the player overlapped card, then gain a silver token per each section overlapped.



     Payment: Each Player can get an extra turn by paying 1 gold or 4 silver. After the payment, each player can do step2, and 3 one more time.



     Preoccupancy: This last action of the turn. Players can place their maker on the card that the latest place. It doesn't have to be placed on top of your own mole.



     Replenishment: After finish, all actions, draw cards from the player's hand to replenish the player's hand back to four.


End of the Game, When a player uses all of their cards, the other players can no longer cover up the sections occupied by any moles as they play their cards, and the game will be continued to play until the last player takes a turn(like a Splender). The player who succeeded in securing the most mole of their player color becomes the winner.

Kamikaze Nanobots is a strategic, multi-player, hyper-aggressive, shoot ’em up board game. Carnage and self-destruction are actively encouraged in pursuit of victory.

The aim of the game is to destroy your opponent’s MOTHERSHIP whilst protecting your own.

Players attack and defend using SHIPS filled with NANOBOTS. SHIPS can perform different ACTIONS depending on the number of NANOBOTS onboard.

A player loses the game when a single SHOT hits their MOTHERSHIP’S core.

The game is available to print (3d printer and desktop printer needed).

—description from the designer

The Tank Museum brings history to life, with the world's best collection of tanks and explosive live displays. Our exhibitions tell the story of armoured warfare spanning over 100 years of history. Exploring seven powerful exhibitions, you will come face to face with almost 300 armoured vehicles. This unique collection is regarded as the finest in the world.

Take your pick from 6 exclusive tokens: Tiger I, Tog II, Mark IV, Army Boot, Wrench or Beret and race around board purchasing historic tanks and building tank sheds to drive the competition off the battlefield.

Who's got the money? Who can you trust?

A heist is going down. Thieves want the loot, though it’s safer if their partner is holding the bag. Guards want to recover the loot and get more glory if they recover it themselves. And a detective just wants to know who did it.

This fast-paced game is full of twists and turns just like your favorite heist movie. The gameplay is similar to Love Letter but without any player elimination. You always have one character card and one object card—on your turn you might gain information or even switch characters.

—description from the designer

The game of the Pays de Caen.
From Ouistreham to Argences, from Evrecy to Troarn, discover the country of Caen while having fun.
Nearly 550 questions and photos on various themes such as geography, heritage, history, famous people, current affairs, traditions but also charades and riddles.

And "junior" questions for children, 7+


Le Jeu du Pays de Caen.

De Ouistreham à Argences, de Evrecy à Troarn, découvrez le pays de Caen en vous amusant.
Jeu de société original, local et convivial, à découvrir entre amis ou en famille..
Partez de votre commune et redécouvrez votre territoire en vous amusant.
Près de 550 questions et photos sur des thèmes variés tels que la géographie, le patrimoine, l'histoire, les personnages célèbres, l'actualité, les traditions mais aussi des charades et des devinettes.

Et pour les enfants à partir de 7 ans, des questions "junior".
